content.question: Which of the following accurately compares the economic policies of two countries studied in the AP Comparative Government and Politics course?

choices.label: In China, special economic zones (SEZs) have been established to promote private industry, while in Mexico, there has been increased privatization of the oil industry.
In Russia, oil and gas industries have been completely privatized, while in Mexico, the oil industry has partnered with foreign companies to extract oil.
In the United Kingdom, natural resources are mostly privately controlled, while in Iran, the government has adopted socialism as a means to become a regional power.
In Russia, Putin has nationalized the oil industry, while in the United Kingdom, most natural resources are controlled by the government.

content.answer: In China, special economic zones (SEZs) have been established to promote private industry, while in Mexico, there has been increased privatization of the oil industry.

unit.text: 5: Political and Economic Changes and Development

topic.text: 5.2: Political Responses to Global Market Forces

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Explain the implications of the similarities and differences between countries with different political systems, principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
